name: Potassium nitrite
desc: Potassium nitrite (distinct from potassium nitrate) is the inorganic compound with the chemical formula KNO2. It is an ionic salt of potassium ions K+ and nitrite ions NO2−, which forms a white or slightly yellow, hygroscopic crystalline powder that is soluble in water.
Appearance:
white or slight yellow solid
deliquescent
EU classification (DSD) (outdated):
Oxidant (O)
Harmful (Xn)
Dangerous for the environment (N)
